xxl.core.indexStructures
Class MVBTree

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree
          xxl.core.indexStructures.MVBTree
Direct Known Subclasses:
AutoDeleteMVBTree
public class MVBTree
extends BPlusTree

This Class is an implementation of MVBT index structure "An asymptotically optimal multiversion B-tree" Becker Bruno, Gschwind Stephan, Ohler Thomas, Seeger Bernhard and Widmayer, Peter VLDB 1996

Nested Class Summary
protected static class MVBTree.BlockDelInfo
          Contains information about one block of the MVBTree, i.e. the block's ID in the underlying container and the block's deletion version.
 class MVBTree.LeafEntry
          This class represents the entries which can be stored in the leaves of the MVBTree.
static class MVBTree.Lifespan
          Objects of this class are version intervals and represent life spans of the entries sotred in the MVBTree.
static class MVBTree.LifeSpanSeparator
          Need to handle root in the bplus tree with max key
protected  class MVBTree.MVBTreeQueryCursor
           
static class MVBTree.MVRegion
           
static class MVBTree.MVSeparator
           
 class MVBTree.Node
          This class represents the Nodes of the MVBTree.
 class MVBTree.NodeConverter
          This Converter is concerned with serializing of nodes to write or read them into or from the external storage.
 class MVBTree.PriorityQueryCursor
          Test Cursor
 class MVBTree.Root
          The instances of this class are refernces pointing to a root node of the MVBTree.
static interface MVBTree.Version
          This is an interface for version instances used by the MVBTree.

 MVBTree.MVRegion toMVRegion(MVBTree.MVSeparator mvSeparator)
          Converts a MVSeparator into a MVRegion on the following wise: mvSeparator.insertVersion() --> begin Version of the MVRegion mvSeparator.deleteVersion() --> end Version of the MVRegion mvSeparator.sepValue() --> begin key of the MVRegion mvSeparator.sepValue() --> end key of the MVRegion
 MVBTree.MVSeparator toMVSeparator(MVBTree.MVRegion region)
          Converts a MVRegion into a MVSeparator on the following wise: region.beginVersion() --> insertion Version of the MVSeparator region.endVersion() --> deletion Version of the MVSeparator region.minBound() --> separation key of the MVSeparator region.maxBound() --> will be ignored.

purgeQueue

protected Queue<MVBTree.BlockDelInfo> purgeQueue
This queue contains an entry for each dead block of the MVBTree. The heap's root is the next block which will be purged.

Constructor Detail

MVBTree

public MVBTree(int blockSize,
               float minCapRatio,
               float e)
Creates a new MVBTree. KeyDomainMinValue set to default value @see DEAFUALT_KEYDOMAIN_MINVALUE

Parameters:
blockSize - the block size of the underlaying Container.
minCapRatio - the minimal capacity ratio of the tree's nodes.
e - the epsilon of the strong version condition.

MVBTree

public MVBTree(int blockSize,
               float e)
Creates a new MVBTree. The minimal capacity ratio of the tree's nodes is set ot 50%.

Parameters:
blockSize - the block size of the underlaying Container.
e - the epsilon of the strong version condition.

               float e,

Creates a new MVBTree. The minimal capacity ratio of the tree's nodes is set ot 50%.

Parameters:
blockSize - the block size of the underlaying Container.
e - the epsilon of the strong version condition.

Parameters:

dataConverter - a Converter to convert the data objects stored in the MVBTree.

the initialized MVBTree.

currentVersion

public MVBTree.Version currentVersion()
Gives the current Version of the MVBTree, i.e. the Version of the last update operation (insertion, deletion or update).

Returns:
the current Version of the MVBTree.

setCurrentVersion

public void setCurrentVersion(MVBTree.Version version)
This method is normaly used during an update operation (insertion, deletion or update) to update the current Version of the MVTree. Also it checks whether this chage is valid, i.e. the new Version has to be greater than the old current Version.

Parameters:
version - the new current Version.

setCutoffVersion

public void setCutoffVersion(MVBTree.Version version)
Sets the cutoff version. The cutoff version is the oldest version whose elements are to be kept. All versions before the cutoff version can be purged.

Parameters:
version - cutoff version

purge

protected void purge()
Removes all blocks from the container which died before the cutoff version.

toMVRegion

public MVBTree.MVRegion toMVRegion(MVBTree.MVSeparator mvSeparator)
Converts a MVSeparator into a MVRegion on the following wise:
  • mvSeparator.insertVersion() --> begin Version of the MVRegion
  • mvSeparator.deleteVersion() --> end Version of the MVRegion
  • mvSeparator.sepValue() --> begin key of the MVRegion
  • mvSeparator.sepValue() --> end key of the MVRegion

Parameters:
mvSeparator - the MVSeparator which is to convert.
Returns:
the new MVRegion.

toMVSeparator

public MVBTree.MVSeparator toMVSeparator(MVBTree.MVRegion region)
Converts a MVRegion into a MVSeparator on the following wise:
  • region.beginVersion() --> insertion Version of the MVSeparator
  • region.endVersion() --> deletion Version of the MVSeparator
  • region.minBound() --> separation key of the MVSeparator
  • region.maxBound() --> will be ignored.

Parameters:
region - the MVRegion which is to convert.
Returns:
the new MVSeparator.

                                         java.util.Stack path)
Computes the region of the subtree pointed by the given entry.

Parameters:
entry - the root of the subtree.
path - the path from the root to the Node in which the given entry is stored.
Returns:
the region of the subtree pointed by the given entry.

pathToNode

protected java.util.Stack pathToNode(BPlusTree.KeyRange nodeRegion,
                                     int level)
Description copied from class: BPlusTree
This method determines the path from the root to a Node. The Node is specified by its key range. The level parameter is required to determine the target level. The path nodes are fixed in the underlayig buffer. If they are no longer required the caller has to unfix them.

Overrides:
pathToNode in class BPlusTree
Parameters:
nodeRegion - the KeyRange of the Node
level - the level on which the Node is
Returns:
the path from the root to the Node with the given KeyRange on the given level

pathToNode

protected java.util.Stack pathToNode(java.lang.Object key,
                                     MVBTree.Version version,
                                     int level)
Builds a path from the appropriate root node to the node which contains the given key in the given version.

Parameters:
key - key to query for.
version - version to query for.
level - tree level at which the search should stop.
Returns:
path from a root node to the correct node at the given level.

grow

protected java.util.Map.Entry grow(java.lang.Object entry)
This method is called when the root node overflows and has been splitted. A new root node must be created. The tree's height increases by one. NOTE: In the opposite to {Tree#grow(Object entry)} this method does not write the new root node into the container. This redurces one access to the underlaying Container.

Overrides:
grow in class Tree
Parameters:
entry - the entry which should be inserted to the new root node. It is normally the old rootEntry.
Returns:
a MapEntry whose key is the new rootEntry and whose value is the new root node.

protected void insert(MVBTree.Version insertVersion,
                      java.lang.Object data,
                      MVBTree.MVSeparator mvSep,
                      int targetLevel)
Inserts a data object into MVBTree.

Parameters:
insertVersion - the Version of this Operation.
data - the data object which is to store.
mvSep - the MVSeparator of the data object.
targetLevel - the target level on which the insertion has to stop (leaf level=0).

query

public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor,
                    int targetLevel)
Description copied from class: BPlusTree
This method calls BPlusTree.query(IndexEntry subRootEntry, KeyRange queryInterval,int targetLevel) which uses an implementation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all entries whose keys are contained in queryDescriptor. Initially query creates the correct parameters for the call.

Overrides:
query in class BPlusTree
Parameters:
queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a Descriptor. In this case it has to an instance of Separator oder KeyRange
targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects
